message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV 

The paper deals with the development of reduced-rank linearly constrained minimum variance (LCMV) algorithms for beamforming, which is a signal processing technique used in various applications such as speech enhancement, radar, and sonar. The paper proposes a joint iterative optimization strategy for the design of the reduced-rank beamformer, which involves adjusting the parameters of a rank-reduction matrix, a reduced-rank beamformer, and diagonal loading in an alternating manner. This optimization strategy involves stochastic gradient and recursive least-squares adaptive algorithms, which are commonly used in machine learning and optimization. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.SI (Signal Processing), followed by cs.IT (Information Theory), cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.CV (Computer Vision).
